Class GameController

java.lang.Object
GameController
public class GameController extends Object
Controls game's core logic, manages this via GameWindow, Player and ObjectMotion classes.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame(GameWindow window, int[] overheadStats, Ball[] magnets, Ball scorePuck, Ball player1, Ball player2)
      This function is the main game loop. It runs the game until one player reaches 6 points
      Parameters:
      window - The GameWindow object that the game is being played in.
      overheadStats - an array of integers that contain the values in the text display
      magnets - the array of magnet ball that are on the board
      scorePuck - the puck that is used to score points
      player1 - The first player's ball
      player2 - The second player's ball

    • GameRound

      public int[] GameRound(GameWindow window, Ball[] magnets, Ball scorePuck, Ball player1, Ball player2, int[] overheadStats)
      This function is the main game loop. It creates the players, the puck, and the magnets, and then starts the threads for each of them. It then waits for one of the players to lose, and then returns the overhead stats
      Parameters:
      window - The game window
      magnets - an array of 3 magnet objects
      scorePuck - The puck that is used to score points
      player1 - The first player's paddle
      player2 - The second player's paddle
      overheadStats - an array of integers that keeps track of the score, the number of rounds played, and the number of rounds won by each player.
      Returns:
      The modified overhead stats array with a players game wins incremented

    • roundResult

      public int[] roundResult(int[] overheadStats, GameWindow window, int winner)
      This function increments the round wins for the winning player and updates game text to reflect this
      Parameters:
      overheadStats - an array of integers containing info on the state of the game
      window - The GameWindow object that the game is being played in.
      winner - the player who won the round
      Returns:
      The modified overheadStats array

    • newGame

      public void newGame(GameWindow window, int[] overheadStats, int winner)
      Creates a new game
      Parameters:
      window - The GameWindow instance that is currently running.
      overheadStats - an array of integers that contains the following information:
      winner - the player who won the game
